title: 以色列國會議員Ayelet Shaked：我們應該殺死所有巴勒斯坦人的母親。

replies.msg:
以巴衝突未見平息，但無數無辜的平民卻在戰火中喪掉性命，當中又以巴勒斯坦人佔大多數；不過，作為以色列人，似乎另有看法，認為自己國家是「出師有名」。

來自極右勢力並推崇極端民族主義的以色列國會議員Ayelet Shaked，就揚言應「殺盡所有巴勒斯坦人的母親」，「他們要死，他們的屋要被夷平，那他們就不可以再盛載更多的恐怖分子；他們是我們的敵人，他們的血應該在我們手中。」



http://www.post852.com/32983/%E4%BB%A5%E8%89%B2%E5%88%97%E5%9C%8B%E6%9C%83%E8%AD%B0%E5%93%A1ayelet-shaked%EF%BC%9A%E6%88%91%E5%80%91%E6%87%89%E8%A9%B2%E6%AE%BA%E6%AD%BB%E6%89%80%E6%9C%89%E5%B7%B4%E5%8B%92%E6%96%AF%E5%9D%A6/

replies.msg:
Things change. In 1947 (not in 48) Palestine was a majority Arab country. Jews were less than one third of the population, and the majority of them was new immigrants (many of them illegal immigrants). Yet the resolution 181 of 29 november 1947, allocated 55% of the land to a Jewish state. Anyone looking at this decision from a neutral point of view would have found this unjust. It is true that something must have been done to ensure the safety of Jews. World War II finished only 2 years ago and obviously Europe was still not a stable region. But to expect that the price of atrocities committed against the Jews in Europe be paid by Palestinians was not something the Palestinians would accept or find reasonable. To Palestinians this was just another attempt by superpowers to to implicate others in solving their problems.
Today, there has been an Israel for almost 70 years. Generations of Israelis have been born here and know no other home. Palestinian acceptance for a solution that would guarantee the presence of Israel or at least Israel's jews (in case of one state solution) emanates from this understanding that we cannot and would not force another ethnic cleansing here. This would not be the solution and any solution should not again come at the expense of disposessing another people.

The 1947 Partition Plan was a proposal regarding the rejection of Palestinian self determination. Palestine's indigenous Arab majority had been promised independence by the British, but Britain's duplicity saw this independence melt away.

The plan was a recommendation that instead of granting Palestine's indigenous Arab majority independence, they would take 55% of their land, including 85% of their agricultural land, and turn it over to a European immigrant minority for them to establish a Jewish state.

Naturally, the Palestinian Arabs were not going to cooperate with their dispossession. What people would?

As events transpired, the British declined to implement the Partition Plan and it became a dead letter. But that didn't stop the Zionist terror groups from cleansing hundreds of thousands of Palestine's Arabs.

When the British Mandate expired in 1948, surrounding armies attempted to stop the ethnic cleansing, but were no match for the well armed, disciplined Zionist terror groups.

So the Palestinians rejected their dispossession in 1947 for the same reason any people anywhere on the planet would reject it. Today, very few (are there any?) Palestinians are fighting for a return to the Partition lines. Most either want Israel to end its occupation, theft and colonisation of Palestine and return to the pre-67 lines, or to have a single democratic state over all of historic Palestine.
